sanskrit_verse:
एवं दृढव्रतो नित्यं ब्रह्मचारी समाहितः ।
समाप्ते द्वादशे वर्षे ब्रह्महत्यां व्यपोहति ॥ ११.८१॥
transliteration:
evaṁ dṛḍhavrato nityaṁ brahmacārī samāhitaḥ |
samāpte dvādaśe varṣe brahmahatyāṁ vyapohati || 11.81||
sph_interpretive_translation: Thus, the celibate who is resolute in vow, ever-controlled, and inwardly concentrated—upon completing twelve years, he fully resolves the karmic burden of brahmahatya.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from sustained alignment with Brahman
Causation arises through sequential spiritual discipline
Capacity-based responsibility is calibrated by inner integration, not time alone
Restoration logic operates through completion of dharmic process
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent maintains uninterrupted celibacy AND demonstrates internal focus AND completes twelve-year cycle THEN karmic liability for brahmahatya is nullified
IF agent exhibits deviation in conduct OR mental dispersion THEN continuation of term until full restoration
IF consciousness-level attestation confirms resolution THEN legal record shall reflect completion status
NO punitive consequence SHALL apply; restoration is automatic upon fulfillment of causal condition
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that spiritual discipline constitutes a valid and sufficient cause for dissolution of karmic liabilities. The threshold of responsibility lies in demonstrable alignment rather than temporal duration. Authority flows from realized consciousness, not procedural formality.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality shows that brahmahatya dissolves when the agent achieves unbroken samadhi through disciplined living. Anupūrvaśaḥ manifests as progressive purification culminating in the twelfth year. Responsibility is proportional to awareness depth. Non-punitive reality rule confirms that no external penalty attaches where consciousness has resolved the root distortion.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Verification of twelve-year adherence under qualified supervision
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Self-reporting of mental and behavioral consistency
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Reintegration into higher dharmic function post-resolution
Integrity Reintegration Framework: Public acknowledgment of restored spiritual standing
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as the Source of all Dharma. This law restores reality to its non-punitive essence, aligns action with consciousness, and affirms the supremacy of spiritual completion over judicial reckoning.
